author: Boone Bergsma
title: ADA MakerSpace Hackathon
description: As a DEV learning Marlowe and Plutus can be challenging on your own, and as a entrepreneur finding DEVs to work with is also a challenge!

assessments.note: No project plan, no budget, no timeline, no information required to effectively address the challenge exists here.
The proposal addresses the challenge, but as there is no detailed plan and estimates (KPIs) established, it is difficult to measure the impact of the Hackathon.
Several developers have had intros to Marlowe via the ADA Makerspace series. This proposal is not complete but the team behind this has done solid work before.
no information beyond the relevant experience is provided that could be used to review the proposer's past experience.

There is no detailed execution plan, just a rationale / ideas. The proposal describes that the team members have taken part in over 40 hackathons combined, but there are no details on the participation of the proposers in these aforementioned Hackathons. Did they organize these events or were they just participants? What is the experience of the proposers in organizing this type of event? This is not clear.
this is an incomplete proposal in every sense.

The concept of a Hackathon is aligned with the challenge, there is a rationale, but not a solid and detailed planning. There are no KPIs, no details about budget allocation and no details about the proposers' experience in the Hackathons organization. I recommend including this information so that the community can better understand the team's ability to deliver.

solution: Host multi region (USA, Ukraine, Africa, ?) in-person and virtual hackathon that provides collaborative space DEVs and Entrepreneurs to meet
experience: Team members have taken part in over 40 hackathons combined, started a Crypto Café that hosted blockchain events in the past & have partners
